title: Deploy OO Containerized using AppHub
content:
1. OO chart deployment through AppHub UI uses a "default" storage class if configured. Ensure you configure the desired storage class for the PV and PVC auto-creation.
  2. If PVs are created manually (using the storage class present in the OpenShift Cluster or using shares from an external NFS server), you must mention a storage class name during the manual PV creation. The storage class name must be provided through the YAML editor during chart deployment: 
    global.persistence.storageClasses.ooGlobalStorageClassName: <storage class name>
    For example: global.persistence.storageClasses.ooGlobalStorageClassName: itom-standard

Follow the steps mentioned below to deploy OO Containerized using AppHub: 

  1. Download and upload the application images to the container registry. Before you deploy the application, you must download the required images from Docker Hub or other registries and then upload the images to your registry.
    For AWS, ensure that the containers used by the application are available in the Elastic Container Registry (ECR) for the desired region. For more details, see Create ECR repository.
    For Azure, ensure that the containers used by the application are available in the Azure Container Registry (ACR) for the desired region.
    For other K8s providers, see Download and Upload installation images.
    If you want to download the required images for your specific deployment configuration, you must configure the values.yaml and pass it with -H option while running the generate_download_bundle.sh script.  Otherwise, run the script without -H values.yaml to download all the images listed in the specified chart. 
  2. Make sure you have completed the prerequisite tasks. 
  3. Log into AppHub.
    1. Copy the installation portal URL to a supported browser. The URL uses the following format: https://<external_access_host>:<apphub-port>/apphub.
      For example: https://myhost.mycompany.com:5443/apphub
    2. Log in using the cluster administrator credentials that you provided when you ran the ./install command:
      User name: admin
      Password: Enter the password you provided during OMT installation.
    3. Click LOG IN.
    If you see the "No applications found" message on this page, it means that you haven't uploaded any chart. Follow the steps in Upload the application Helm chart to upload the application chart. 
  4. Configure AppHub parameters.
  5. Deploy the application using AppHub.
    Click Deploy and then enter the following information.
    Parameter Description
    Deployment Name

    Enter a unique name for this deployment. Pay attention to the following naming conventions:

    • Can't contain more than 253 characters
    • Must contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.'
    • Must start with an alphanumeric character
    • Must end with an alphanumeric character
    Deploy to existing namespace Enter an existing namespace or select it from the drop-down list.
    Create new namespace on deployment Depending on your installation environment, you can optionally create a new namespace as part of the deployment. For example, when you enter a name and there are no matching namespaces in the cluster, you can create a new namespace (as long as the namespace name isn't reserved). 
    If your installation environment prohibits AppHub from creating a new namespace in the cluster, you must select an existing namespace.
    Timeout Enter a value in minute(s) to wait for Kubernetes commands to complete. The valid value is between 1 and 153722867.
    End User License Agreement Review and accept the End User License Agreement to continue.
  6. Click OK. AppHub performs a Helm dry run. If the dry run fails, edit the configuration and try again. If the dry run is successful, the deployment process begins and a new deployment tile appears on the Deployments page. On the deployment tile, click the View Details to see the deployment Overview and deployment History.
